history.content: I personally thought it was a really awesome course. I used the edit distance idea that is taught in the course in an interview recently. With that said, can it be self studied? Yes, I really believe that it can because a lot of learning happens by doing the homework (which I think can be found for past semesters along with the webcasts). Other courses, such as those with large-ish projects (161,162,164..etc) may not be as easy to self study because the projects are not as accessible. Just my opinion though!

children.subject: People will tell you it's really good for interviews and the like, and I can confirm that. Even though I found it to be very difficult, taking the class definitely paid off dividends, as I apply the material l learned when doing interviews or practicing for them. You can self study of course, but the textbook is amazing imo. Hope this helps! :)

history.content: I am debating between taking 61C + 168, 61C + 127 and 61C + 170 next semester. I want to take 189 next spring, and I’ve heard 168 is a light upper div and only offered in fall. Can anyone please share view on the usefulness of 170? Is it a must for interview, or are the parts relevant to interview ok to self-study?
history.subject: How crucial is 170?
